moves.1. e4 c5 2. Bc4 Nf6 3. Nc3: As you can see, I am trying to play the Dragon as black.
moves.3... Nc6 4. Nf3 g6 5. d3 Bg7:
This is all standard dragon. White could play:
C1-G5
OR
C1-e3 ...
D1-D2 ...
E3-H6 G7xH6
D2xH6 D8-C7
O-O B6
A1-D1 C8-A6
A time wasting play!
moves.6. Ng5: Ouch. I didn't see the fork for white!
moves.6... Ne5: Ohh. Keep in mind I'm 11. I honestly didn't!
moves.9. Nxf7: Good move!! Saw it coming yet it hit me out of nowhere! I didn't see it coming though.:( But learn from mistakes!
moves.10. Nxh8 Bxh8 11. O-O: So as you can see so far the dragon is a complex and risky opining but if played right it is a powerful opining. He is winning here though.
moves.12... gxf5 13. Rxf5: Well this is more of his blunder. He doesn't have to suport his trade!
moves.15... Nfg4: Well support it when you can!
moves.16... Be5 17. Bf4 Bxc3: I missed this!! Watch closely, you will see what I mean.
moves.18. bxc3 Qxc3: To get the Rook and a little extra.
moves.20. Bc1 Qxc1#: Thank You for watching! Please comment!!

gameName: Good Dragon By an 11 Year old
